review: When I purchased my first Kindle  Fire HD, all I had to do was buy a simple connection which went from the Kindle into the HDMI of the TV and Voila!  - I could watch movies and such on the big screen.  Then when the Kindle Fire HDX came out, I 'upgraded' to it, assuming the connector would work as well.  Well, it wasn't compatible at all.  What was recommended was called "Push TV" from Netgear.  I bought it and struggled to get it to connect, but then once I 'mirrored' the image from my Fire  HDX, there was always a bit of distorted shadow on the background of the TV image.  I EVEN upgraded my router, thinking that would clear up the image.  But it never really was clear so I just tolerated the shadowy image.  Recently, while chatting with a technical representative via the 'Mayday' button on the Fire HDX,  I asked for help with the Push TV and the rep mentioned that she has the Amazon Fire TV Stick and that it works surprisingly well.  So I researched it and thought about it and went ahead and bought it.  I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE IT!  Best thing ever!  It works and was very easy to set-up. I highly recommend it to anyone and everyone.  Good job Amazon!!!  Of course, now I don't know what to do with the Push TV unit ...
author: Peggy T. "Pegs Quest"
